docs.lead_paragraph: Libya's National Oil Corporation (NOC) held an urgent meeting to review crude loading schedules and emergency measures to protect oil facilities after clashes around the major terminals of Es Sider and Ras Lanuf, it said in a statement on Saturday.
docs.snippet: Libya's National Oil Corporation (NOC) held an urgent meeting to review crude loading schedules and emergency measures to protect oil facilities after clashes around the major terminals of Es Sider and Ras Lanuf, it said in a statement on Saturday...

headline.main: Libya's NOC Reviewed Loading Schedules After Clashes Near Oil Ports
headline.print_headline: Libya's NOC Reviewed Loading Schedules After Clashes Near Oil Ports

docs.lead_paragraph: Iran's semi-official ISNA news agency is reporting that the country's judiciary has suspended the prison term of the son of a late dissident cleric.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Pease International Tradeport, which features an airport, hundreds of businesses and several day care centers, has been called a textbook example of how to redevelop an air base.

docs.lead_paragraph: Syria's chief negotiator said on Saturday that the "only thing" achieved at 10-day talks in Geneva was an agreed agenda and that the government wanted a unified opposition delegation as its negotiating partner.

headline.main: Syrian Government Says Agenda Agreed, Seeks United Opposition at Next Geneva Talks

docs.lead_paragraph: Golf carts are ubiquitous in retirement communities. But the slow-moving vehicles are also largely unregulated.

docs.lead_paragraph: General Motors and France's PSA Group will hold a press conference on Monday morning, they said on Saturday, with the subject expected to be the acquisition of the U.S. carmaker's loss-making Opel unit.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nigeria wants Royal Dutch Shell to reopen one of its main pipelines but the oil multinational is resisting, analysts say, for fear it could once again be bombed by militants.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jose Evrard's left-wing credentials were impeccable. His great-uncle Victor, he recounts with pride, was a French communist executed by the Nazis; his father worked in a coal mine; Evrard himself was a card-carrying French communist for 36 years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Deutsche Bank's supervisory board will meet on Sunday to discuss plans for a potential capital increase of around 8 billion euros ($8.5 billion), two sources familiar with the matter said on Saturday.
